The idol can not be worn.

items.name: a sparkling shard of reflective soulstone

raw: Gazing into the depths of the sparkling shard, you see nothing but emptiness.
Analysis of a sparkling shard of reflective soulstone indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This shard absorbs the souls of elementals as its wearer lands the killing blow.  When enough soul energy
is collected, it can be activated to reset Elemental Confluence attunement.
It is bound to no one.
PUSH it against a Confluence portal to activate it.
LOOK at it to see how much soul energy it contains.
WEAR it to allow soul absorbtion.
It cannot be altered.
The sparkling shard will cost 700,000 coins.

It is estimated that a heart-shaped giftbox can store a significant amount with enough space for several items.
The giftbox can not be worn.
Analysis of a heart-shaped giftbox indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a one-time use Glitzy Giftbox that will be destroyed upon unwrapping it.

Your heart-shaped giftbox can hold up to five items.  You may WRITE on it to add a gift tag message.  Change what language you are currently speaking to change the language you write on the gift tag.  Use | for carriage returns.
POKE the giftbox after writing your message to cycle through the 20 available tag types.

You must HUG the box after putting your gifts inside it to seal the contents before wrapping.  If wearing a scent, HUG will also impart an abbreviated version of it to the giftbox that the opener will smell and that will remind them of you.
WRAP MY giftbox WITH <RIBBON or GIFTWRAP> to apply optional ribbon and wrapping paper to it.
Once you have applied either ribbon or giftwrap to the box, you may ATTEND it to cycle through the 10 available description styles.
The heart-shaped giftbox will cost 100,000 coins.

shops.preamble: Caitria's Shop is located in [Heleconia Way] at a bloom-covered cozy bungalow with an ornate seashelled roof, and is currently open for business.

items.name: a poplar-hafted black ora Hammer of Kai

raw: Analysis of a poplar-hafted black ora Hammer of Kai indicates the item has certain alteration restrictions.  It would need to be supplied to be used in an alteration and may only be used as an accent.  Black ora is not considered "pure" unless it can re-curse itself.  This material cannot be dyed.
The black ora Hammer of Kai will cost 500,000 coins.
It is an enhancive item:
It seems to have more than your average dwarf could count enhancive charges remaining.
It is estimated to be worth about 900,000 silvers.

It is temporarily weighted to inflict more critical wounds, but exactly how much requires assessment.  Its temporary enhancement will degrade when it scores a successful strike.  It has quite a few uses left before the enhancement degrades away completely, which will cause the item to lose its ability to inflict greater damage.
It is predominantly crafted of black ora.
It is a complicated project (341 difficulty) for an adventurer to modify.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Landrai.
details.material: black ora, an extraordinarily rare metal
details.flare: the power of an ice elemental

items.name: a lace-collared uhl-claw choker dotted in red agate droplets

raw: Analysis of a lace-collared uhl-claw choker dotted in red agate droplets indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A lace-collared uhl-claw choker dotted in red agate droplets is an Uhl-Claw device designed by the kindred of the T'Kirem Bear Clan.  Its primary purpose is to discourage unwanted attention from those who may have taken a fancy to the wearer.  It is meant to be a subtle device.  To read more about the lore, visit:  https://gswiki.play.net/Uhl-claw.

To use the choker, you must WEAR it and POINT it at the person you do not wish to make advances on you.  Do not worry, this gesture is so subtle that they don't see it has been done until they look upon you.  Once they do look at you they will see the Bear's Warning:  Five slashes, ending in crimson droplets, mar (fancier's) features from (his/her) right temple to (his/her) left cheekbone.
Your uhl-claw choker can store up to 50 unwanted suitors in it.  To change them, GAZE at the choker to get the list and then WHISPER choker REMOVE # to remove the person.

Alterations:  An Uhl-Claw must always be made of silver and have a reflective surface for the magic of the item to work.  There should be some representation of the five claws of Uhlgeer, the she-bear, and corresponding crimson drops that represent the blood her claws can bring to the surface.  Droplets can be made of paint, enamel, lacquer, jewels, etc.  Above all, it must have a reflective surface of some kind.  If creating a ring, you may use uhl-ring.  All other jewelry should have an adjective of "uhl-claw," and this item should never be turned into a solitude ring.
The uhl-claw choker will cost 5,000,000 coins.

========== WEAPON CARTRIDGE ==========
A crimson cartridge etched with a short sword contains the Weapon Cartridge script for Mechanical Cartridge Vambraces.
This cartridge allows you to make attacks and parry empty-handed using the weapon inside.
You must PUT cartridge IN vambraces for it to function.
The cartridge contains a steel blade which is a short sword.
The steel blade is in the cartridge and functioning normally.
The cartridge is UNLOCKED for two-weapon combat.
The cartridge is LOCKED for parrying attacks while unarmed.

The blade may be altered but the noun must remain "blade" and the alter must not indicate that the shape of the blade would not slide properly.  All improvements should be made to the blade itself AND NOT THE CARTRIDGE OR VAMBRACES!
The weapon contained in the cartridge should never be made of anything other than metal!
You can GET the blade FROM the cartridge at any time.  Doing so will prevent the cartridge from functioning.
While detached, the blade may be PUT IN the cartridge.
The crimson cartridge is not attuned to anyone and may be used.
The steel blade contains the Weapon Cartridge Weapon script for Mechanical Cartridge Vambraces.
It can be altered by any merchant but the noun MUST remain blade.
This weapon should never be altered to anything other than metal!
The crimson cartridge will cost 35,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 0 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of metal.

items.name: a veniom-traced segmented low steel spear

raw: It has a small enchanter's glyph.  A strange necrotic haze radiates from the spear.  A strong aura of holy light radiates from the spear.
Analysis of a veniom-traced segmented low steel spear indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The low steel spear is a specially crafted polearm weapon, split into segments that are joined with chain links.  When used in melee combat, this will allow the weapon to extend, allowing a reach bonus of up to 5 feet over a standard weapon of the same base.  The weapon will also have a standard chance to flare with slash or crush damage when used in this manner.

When the weapon is HURLed, its head will separate from its base, staying tethered via the chained segments holding the weapon together.  The shaft of the weapon will will remain in the attacker's hand.  After such an attack, the shaft may be PULLed in order to reform the weapon.  If the head has been lodged in a creature or player, it will be torn out violently, inflicting unbalance damage.
RP Verb Traps: PULL, TOSS, TURN, WAVE.

Basic alterations to the low steel spear are fine, but keep its unique construction in mind when creating its description.  The material of the head of the spear is based on the weapon's material, and should not be changed.  The material of the chain of the spear may be changed to a reasonable metal.  Higher rarity may require additional approvals.  Only the article and material can be altered with the spear head.  The shaft can have a standard alterations applied and have either a long description or show description.
Spear head description:
a low steel spear head trailed by a shimmering veniom chain
Spear shaft description:
a veniom-traced dark witchwood shaft / an veniom-traced dark witchwood shaft
The spear has the following alterable settings:
Shaft article:       a veniom-traced
Shaft adjective:     dark witchwood
Shaft noun:          shaft
Shaft show or long:  an veniom-traced dark witchwood shaft
Spear head:          low steel
Chain article        a shimmering
Chain material:      veniom

items.name: a rhomboid low steel mantlet reinforced with a mithglin edge

raw: It has a small enchanter's glyph.  A strange necrotic haze radiates from the mantlet.  A strong aura of holy light radiates from the mantlet.
The mantlet is a tower shield that protects the bearer if carried in the left hand.  It is spiked.
Analysis of a rhomboid low steel mantlet reinforced with a mithglin edge indicates the creator has provided the following information:
---- Animalistic Spirit Shields ----
=General Script Information=
This is a shield with the spirit of an animal trapped within it.
The spirit is wild and must be tamed by unleashing it against like-level foes, or successfully blocking against them during combat.
If not fully tame, the spirit within can backlash upon the owner.
Allegiance can be changed, but the new owner must work off the trust gained by the previous owner.
When striking, there is a chance the spirit will unleash Animalistic Fury flares.
=Alteration Guidelines=
* Alterations to the 15/15/15, long and show of this shield are fine.
* Some merchants can change the spirit color, spirit call, spirit group, or how the spirit looks.
NOTE: You cannot change the general type of animal, such as changing a large feline to be a canine, except using certificates.
As well, each spirit type only has certain pre-approved nouns allowed.
=Features=
* Animalistic Fury Flares (Tier 4 of 4)
The spirit within lashes out with a stampede. (Damage Type: Disintegrate)
Flares are currently: ON [RUB to toggle]
* Revenge Flares = Unlocked
On a successful block, there is a chance to unleash Animalistic Fury flares.  You must be in a forward or greater stance and be an active combatant in combat for the spirit to react.
NOTE: Power of this ability is tied to the Flare tier.
* Wild Backlash = Unlocked
When Animalistic Fury flares hit, the spirit within lashes out with its untamed anger, causing a momentary reduction in the target's DS and TD.
NOTE: Power of this ability is tied to the Flare tier.
* Savage Power = Locked
Once an hour, draw on the power of the spirit within your weapon for an increase in AS, CS and critical padding by CLENCHing the mantlet.
* Flavor Actions (Tier 1 of 3)
At this tier, this shield captures the following:WEAR, REMOVE, RUB (Flares On/Off), WHISTLE.
* Tameness/Affinity
Tame the spirit to prevent it enacting its rage upon you.
Only one person can have allegiance to this shield's spirit at a time.
The feeling of this spirit toward someone else is tame (Level 12 of 12).

NOTE: To switch this shield's allegiance to you, you must drop the shield's tameness to the previous owner by damaging like-level creatures with it or blocking attacks from like-level foes while in combat.
=Current Settings=
* Spirit: dolphin (Type: Aquatic Mammal)
Available nouns for this type are: beluga whale, blue whale, dolphin [Default], humpback whale, manatee, narwhal, orca, sea lion, seal, sperm whale, walrus, whale.
* Spirit Descriptor: sleek
* Spirit Color: misty green
* Spirit Call: chitter
* Spirit Group: pod

USAGE:
- CLEAN: Remove an attunement from the slip.  This cannot be done once your request has been submitted.
- POINT: Apply an approved alteration to an attuned object in your private property.
- READ: See the recorded details for your slip.
- WAVE: Wave at an object in your private property to attune this slip to it.
- WHISPER {slip} {BASE}: Add your base alteration request to the slip
- WHISPER {slip} {SHOW}: Add your show alteration request to the slip

raw: Caged in an elegant latticework of wrought gold, the rounded phial is clear as crystal and possessed of a jeweled golden stopper.  The translucent liquid contained within shades from brilliant carmine to a deep burgundy, and rosy reflections play along the curvature of the glass.

Analysis of a gold-bound pellucid glass phial filled with carmine liquid indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The pellucid glass phial is a Polymorph Potion.  When consumed, it will allow you to permanently change your profession.  Use TURN to toggle between all available professions.  It is currently set to an empath.  This process is irreversible except with another polymorph potion.
[Please review the full details and implications of the phial at https://gswiki.play.net/Polymorph_Potion#Polymorph:_Profession ]
The pellucid glass phial will cost 500,000,000 coins.

items.name: some assorted fine gold hip chains

raw: Analysis of some assorted fine gold hip chains indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Illegal Alteration Clothing Line (IACLs) ~*~

This item can have different descriptions when held and worn.  Wait!  What??  That's right, you can now have a tight bodice, low-rise pants, or maybe a long cloak that actually drags on the ground.  Keep in mind that normal alteration rules may still apply based on merchant personalities and general good taste.
Verbs:  ATTEND, REMOVE, RUB and WEAR
Alteration Guidelines:
* You can have a base, long, and show
* Base:  the same for both worn and unworn
* Long:  not required for unworn (unless you want a show) but required for worn
* Show:  not required, but if you have it, it will be the same for worn and unworn, and you will need a long for unworn too
* DISALLOWED:  Anything that references exposed skin is not allowed (so no shoulder-baring shirts or tight pants revealing a toned abdomen, for example)
* Overly Risque Items:  This script is not meant to get around any policies on overly risque items.  The merchant has final say on this.
This item has the following worn description:
a waist-draped assortment of fine gold chains cascading to mid-thigh
The fine gold hip chains will cost 2,000,000 coins.

raw: It is estimated that a flowing ash grey satin robe hemmed in tone-on-tone flames can store a fairly small amount with enough space for several items.
You determine that the ash grey satin robe is an armor concealing garment that will hide leather, scale, chain mail and plate mail armor which covers torso, arms, legs and head when it is worn.
Analysis of a flowing ash grey satin robe hemmed in tone-on-tone flames indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The ash grey satin robe is designed to hide leather, scale, chain mail and plate mail armor which covers torso, arms, legs and head.
This garment should be designed in such a manner to convey that ALL these areas are completely covered.
You carefully analyze your ash grey satin robe and sense that there are some alteration restrictions.  The robe can have either a long or a show description.

Any outer garment noun may be used for armor concealers as long as they are loose fitting and fully cover the appropriate areas of protection (tunics do not cover legs, so they may not cover leg worn armor, a shawl would not be appropriate at all, etc.).
Armor concealers that cover the head MUST have a hood/cowl in the base (15/15/15) and in any long descriptions.
Armor concealers can be made out of any material that is not see-through.
Racial clothing nouns are approved as follows:
Ruhan ~ This garment is knee-length or shorter and should not have a hood, so it cannot cover armor with leg or head protection.  This concealer cannot be pocketed.
Toque ~ This noun is approved for any armor and may have a hood.

Cotehardie ~ This noun may be used but must clearly be an outer garment that falls to the knees (so it cannot cover armor with leg protection) and is not-tight fitting.  It should be used as an elven outer garment, not a gown.
Apotl/Apotla ~ These are fine for concealers, but since it is a waist-length cloak, it only covers torso and arms.
Atanika/Ataniki ~ These nouns are approved for concealers but should not have a hood.
The ash grey satin robe will cost 12,000,000 coins.

items.name: a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards

raw: Across the surface of the ring, spots of ochre and brown stains radiate from tiny crystalline structures embedded in the bone.  Ichor green motes and shadows lurk within the crystals, living inclusions that alternately lighten and darken the calcification along the ring's edges.  A faint pulse, deep and bone-jarring, accompanies the flickering, beating like a necrotic heart.
Analysis of a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The smooth bone ring is a prize from the Arena of the Abyss (Ebon Gate event).  When worn, it has a chance to summon an undead creature from a recently slain creature.
Attuned: No one
Charges: 0 (ON, PROD to toggle)
Lich's Curse: 0% (ON, TAP to toggle)
Voln's Blessing: 0%
Appearance: ON (COVER to toggle)

Lich's Curse is a % chance for the undead the ring spawns to be a boss creature.  Voln's Blessing is a % chance for the ring owner to receive +15 AS/DS and +10 CS/TD for 30 seconds when they kill the undead the ring spawned.
The ring cannot be altered in any way!
The smooth bone ring will cost 550,000 coins.

Analysis of a faenor nugget indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Your nugget is used to unlock the potential of things held in your other hand or on your person.
A faenor nugget grants the ability to transmute an eligible enhancive armament into a jewelry item.
DETAILS:
> Eligible armaments include armor, weapons, shields, armor accessories, and UCS gloves/boots.
> The armament must be unscripted.  Looted feras items are permitted.
> In most cases, the resulting jewelry item is "a/an/some <material> <noun>."
> Wooden belts will be "a/an <material>-linked belt."
> Enhancive, attunement, and loresong recall properties will transfer.
> The source item will be destroyed.
> Nouns are dictated by the selected worn location for the transmute.
> Use LOOK to view the current setting.
> Use TURN [to #] to toggle to the next or a specific worn location.  Currently: PIN
(1) pin  [pin]           (7)  arms   [armbands]
(2) head [crown]         (8)  wrist  [bracelet]
(3) hair [barrette]      (9)  finger [ring]
(4) ear  [earring]       (10) waist  [belt]
(5) ears [earrings]      (11) ankle  [anklet]
(6) neck [necklace]
You need only RAISE your nugget while holding a compatible item in your other hand or on your person.
Your nugget may not be altered or changed in any way.
The faenor nugget will cost 35,000,000 coins.

items.name: a grease-dappled taupe linen shirt trimmed in stained embroidery

raw: Analysis of a grease-dappled taupe linen shirt trimmed in stained embroidery indicates the item is flagged as Alteration Fodder.
The item has Flourishes that do the following:
This is an EzScripted item.  Some alteration restrictions may apply.  It has the following messaging:
pull
1st Person: You pull up the neckline of your taupe linen shirt and chew on it, dampening the material with your saliva.
3rd Person: Brodega pulls up the neckline of his taupe linen shirt and chews on it, dampening the material with his saliva.
smell
1st Person: You take a big whiff of the armpit of your taupe linen shirt.  It could smell worse.
3rd Person: Brodega takes a big whiff of the armpit of his taupe linen shirt.
push
1st Person: You dig your fingers into the armpit of your taupe linen shirt, scratching away.  That feels better!
3rd Person: Brodega digs his fingers into the armpit of his taupe linen shirt, scratching with vigor.
If there is a typo in the above messaging, please ASSIST and request a referral to speak to a GameMaster to fix it.  DO NOT BUG or BUGITEM the shirt!
The taupe linen shirt will cost 35,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 25,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of cloth.
It has the EZScript Flourish.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Yakushi.

items.name: an etched sunstone jewel aswirl with sunset hues

raw: A mirage-like haze of arcane influence clings to the jewel, alight with half-glimpsed glyphs refracting across its facets from within.  The effect is dizzying and makes further visual inspection difficult.
Rarity:      Common
Mnemonic:    limitbreaksa
Description: Your enhancive limit on Spell Aiming is raised by 2/4/6/8/10 points.
The jewel can not be worn.
The sunstone jewel will cost 10,000,000 coins.

gemstone_properties.name: Limit Break: Spell Aiming (Rank 1 of 5)
gemstone_properties.description: Your enhancive limit on Spell Aiming is raised by 2/4/6/8/10 points.

items.name: a rotting witchwood crosier capped with a glowing violet orb

raw: It has a small enchanter's glyph.
Analysis of a rotting witchwood crosier capped with a glowing violet orb indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a runestaff with a glowing orb.  It is fully unlocked.  When altering, it must always contain a glowing orb in its description.
The witchwood crosier will cost 5,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 450,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of witchwood.
It may be enchanted up to a bonus of 25 by a wizard and was last enchanted by Silencieux.
It is an involved project (233 difficulty) for an adventurer to modify.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Demid.
details.flare: the power of a disintegrating substance

raw: Analysis of a topaz-inset platinum torc indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The platinum torc will cost 5,000,000 coins.
It is an enhancive item:
It seems to have a lot of enhancive charges remaining.
It will crumble into dust after its last enhancive charge has been expended.
It is estimated to be worth about 350,000 silvers.
It is magic resistant.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Exreks.
The forest green lock appears to be flawlessly crafted from a vibrant glass material.
As your gaze lingers on the lock, a crystal clear image of a vibrant forest green key appears in your mind.  You are suddenly filled with an overwhelming desire to complete the pair.
There appears to be something written on it.
In the Common language, it reads:

This holy relic is the sacrosanct property of the Fraternal Order of ...illegible....  If found outside of its sacred home, kindly contact the nearest Lodge at your earliest convenience.  May ...illegible... become fascination.
The illegible portions appear to have been defaced.
The lock can not be worn.
The forest green lock will cost 4,850,000 coins.

Three slender metal blades are attached to the head of the arrow.  They are angled so that they lie parallel to one another along the long shaft of the arrow.  Tightly coiled steel springs are clearly visible beneath the blades.  You also notice a small enchanter's mark.
The slender black arrow will cost 5,000,000 coins.
A tiny brass gear is etched with an even tinier script reading, "899 - This will increase a widget's length of time per use from 30 minutes to 60 minutes.."
The gear can not be worn.
Analysis of a tiny brass gear indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Fizwixit's Wonderful Widgets ~*~
This brass gear is used to update your Fizwixit's Wonderful Widget by increasing its total minutes per use from 30 to 60 minutes.

If you do not already have what this gear offers and wish to add it, you need to hold your widget in one hand and this in the other and PUSH (WIDGET NOUN).  These gears may be freely sold/traded with others.  They cannot be altered.
~*~ End Custom Analyze ~*~
The brass gear will cost 500,000 coins.

The potion can not be worn.
Analysis of a dark blue potion indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a potion of fixskills.  Drinking it will instantly migrate and adjust all of your skills to your current
goals, just as if you had used the FIXSKILLS command.  The use of this potion does not
remove your normal chance to use FIXSKILLS.
It has 1 dose remaining.
DRINK it to activate it and consume a dose.
LOOK IN it to check its remaining doses.
POUR it into other potions like it to combine doses.
It cannot be altered.
The dark blue potion will cost 6,000,000 coins.
In neat calligraphy, it reads:
"This pack entitles the presenter to 2 expedited task reassignments, courtesy of the Adventurer's Guild.  Valid only on tasks voluntarily removed."
"To redeem this Guild voucher pack, please GIVE it to headmaster of any Adventurer's Guild location."
The pack can not be worn.

This pack contains 2 expedited task reassignment vouchers for the Adventurer's Guild, valid only on tasks voluntarily removed.
GIVE the pack to an Adventurer's Guild Headmaster to redeem the vouchers and add them to your total in BOUNTY.
BUNDLE it with other packs like it to combine uses.
TEAR it to remove a single voucher.
It cannot be altered.
The Guild voucher pack will cost 1,000,000 coins.

items.name: a gleaming vaalorn aegis emblazoned with a stylized red steel dragon

raw: Rippling striations of red and gold flow throughout the vaalorn of this shield, the variations in hue only enhanced by its gleaming finish.  Contrasting the polished surface beneath it, a raised section of matte red steel molded into the shape of a snarling dragon covers the entire upper half.  Inlaid strips of silver add detail to the dragon's outstretched wings, while tiny chips of emerald glitter from within its deep-set eye sockets.
The aegis is a large shield that protects the bearer if carried in the left hand.
Analysis of a gleaming vaalorn aegis emblazoned with a stylized red steel dragon indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is an EzScripted item.  Some alteration restrictions may apply.  It has the following messaging:
wear

1st Person: You easily sling your vaalorn aegis over your shoulder.  The movement causes a slight vibration to run through the steel dragon on its surface, building into a faint thrum that sounds like a low growl.

3rd Person: Brodega easily slings his vaalorn aegis over his shoulder.  The movement causes a slight vibration to run through the steel dragon on its surface, building into a faint thrum that sounds like a low growl.
remove

1st Person: You easily sling your vaalorn aegis off of your shoulder and settle it into position.  The movement causes a slight vibration to run through the steel dragon on its surface, building into a faint thrum that sounds like a low growl.

3rd Person: Brodega easily slings his vaalorn aegis off of his shoulder and settles it into position.  The movement causes a slight vibration to run through the steel dragon on its surface, building into a faint thrum that sounds like a low growl.
raise

3rd Person: Brodega pounds his vaalorn aegis in a staccato rhythm and raises it in triumph!  The vibrations from the blow hum through the steel dragon on its surface and build into a roar of sound before fading away.

Rarity:      Common
Mnemonic:    dispulsionward
Description: When an enemy targets you with a dispel, there is a 33% chance that the enemy will be subject to an SMR test.  On a failure, the dispel has no effect on you.
Rarity:      Common
Mnemonic:    bindingshot

Description: Your successful ranged weapon attacks have a standard flare chance to release a canister containing a net, Rooting the target for 5 seconds.  If the target is killed by your attack, the canister will instead ricochet to another target in the room.
The jewel can not be worn.
The sunny yellow jewel will cost 9,999,999 coins.

In the Common language, it reads:
This note can be REDEEMed to increase an appropriate item's capacity by 10 pounds up to a maximum of:
Back and shoulder containers: 140 pounds
Slung on shoulder containers: 60 pounds
Torso, attached to belt, and front containers: 40 pounds
NOTE: If your item's capacity limit is lower than the service amount, the item is ineligible.
Tiny and extremely tiny containers are also ineligible for use with this note.
The note can not be worn.
Analysis of a pale pink note indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This pink note can be REDEEMed to increase the capacity of a worn container (back, shoulder, slung on shoulder, torso, attached to belt, and front) by 10 pounds.  Containers worn in other locations are not eligible for this note.

Please note that in some cases, this increase may change your item from non-functional to functional.  In addition, any items restricted to hold a specific number of items (ie: your container will only hold one item) will still only hold X number of items.  This note will not change that.  Normal restrictions will apply and may vary from item to item.
Some scripted items are eligible for redemption with this pink note.
A pale pink note is a single-use note.
HUG your note to see a list of denied scripts.
The pink note will cost 50,000 coins.

items.name: a length of lush twining evergreen garland

raw: The garland can not be worn.
Analysis of a length of lush twining evergreen garland indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This garland is a Deck the Halls room decoration and is designed to be decorated with a gem, feather, flower, insects and sea creatures, pointed items, ribbons, or other miscellaneous items and PLACEd out in a room or private property to decorate the area.  Miscellany includes other foraged items, skins, shells, and other larger non-gem treasure items.  The garland has several distinct descriptions, depending on what item is inserted.  To insert an item, hold the garland in one hand, the item you'd like to insert in the opposite hand, and PUSH garland.  PULLing the garland will remove the item and restore the garland to its empty description.
Alteration Guidelines:
While each side is highly customizable, both the noun and material need to remain the same for all sides.  Sides not displayed below cannot be used until a description is added by a merchant.
The sides currently are:
Short: twining garland
Flower: a length of twining garland interspersed with <adj>s

This item has Stay-Put qualities.  If you PLACE it, it will be moved to the ground in your current room and stay there, unable to be picked up by others or taken by the janitor, for 4 hours.  After the duration expires, the item is fair game for others and for the janitor.  Alternately, the item may be PLACEd by the owner of a private property within the grounds of the property or by the owner of a stall or loft in and will stay there until PLACEd again.
The twining garland will cost 250,000 coins.

It is estimated that a sky blue topaz-adorned yoke stitched with golden chevrons can store a small amount with enough space for a couple of items.
Analysis of a sky blue topaz-adorned yoke stitched with golden chevrons indicates the creator has provided the following information:

Looking over the yoke and inspecting its finer details, you realize that it will always need to be "a/n (whatever)/topaz-adorned/baldric or yoke".  This means the item's article CAN be changed.  Only "baldric" and "yoke" are valid as nouns, and the adjective of "topaz-adorned" is unalterable.  Also, the allowed wear-locations are shoulder-worn for baldrics and front-worn for yokes.  So if your alteration involves changing the noun, realize the wear-location MUST BE changed also.

NOTE:  The script's description of the yoke refers to it as "Constructed of layers of (color) (material)..." and bearing a central design of "...nested circles...composed of dozens of faceted crystals," so keep that in mind if you request an alteration.  The material and color of the yoke CAN be changed.  This item cannot accept a SHOW description, since the script already utilizes that mechanism.
The color that the charged crystals glow CAN be changed.  It must be no longer than fifteen characters.
If you were to play with the topaz-adorned yoke, then you'd find that you can analyze, wear, remove, clench, push, and rub it.  RUB releases/casts a charge previously stored from a blue crystal.
NOTE-2:  This yoke will ONLY accept charges from treasure-found crystals.
This is a Tier 1 yoke, with four tiers in total.  This yoke is sold OTS with one tier unlocked.
SCRIPT NAME: Topaz Adorned Baldric
This yoke CANNOT be deepened at all.
The topaz-adorned yoke will cost 500,000 coins.

items.name: a lapis starsilk corset covered in silver starburst-cut lace

raw: It is estimated that a lapis starsilk corset covered in silver starburst-cut lace can store a very small amount with enough space for one item of very small size.
Analysis of a lapis starsilk corset covered in silver starburst-cut lace indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a Vanishing Point corset.  Alterations (long or show) are fine on this provided the item doesn't have a high or restricting neck.  General collars are okay.  It should also be able to completely hide a dagger in the inside lining - no sheer fabrics (chiffon, voile, gauze, etc.) unless they are layered.  Acceptable nouns for this are: corset, bodice, chemise, gown, cotehardie, kirtle, bliaut, dress, houppelande, robe, tunic, or shirt.
This corset is Tier 0 / 1 (two tiers).  Verbs are: GET, PULL, PUT, REMOVE, and WEAR.
The lapis starsilk corset will cost 1,000,000 coins.

The contract can not be worn.
Analysis of a larger locker contract indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This contract grants a temporary boost of +50 maximum items to all lockers for 30 days.
WRITE CONTRACT to activate it.
It cannot be altered.
The larger locker contract will cost 500,000 coins.

This is an EzScripted item.  Some alteration restrictions may apply.  It has the following messaging:
touch
1st Person: You swiftly run your fingers along the bumpy surface of the crown of bones, recalling your adventures in Bonefrost and Darkflorria.

pull

wave

Constructed of thick yellowed glass, this jar is well made and sturdy.  A lid secures the top, while a webbing of interlaced twine wraps around the sides and bottom to secure it into a belt loop.  Murky liquid of an indeterminate color fills the jar, making it difficult to see exact details of what's inside.
Analysis of an old yellowed glass jar indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~Bloodletting Leech Jar~
This jar holds leeches meant for bloodletting.
Currently, this jar can only produce 1 leech daily.
Today, you've pulled 0 leeches.
You will find the following will do something special on this jar:  WEAR, REMOVE, TURN, PULL
You can use INSPECT to see what types of leeches are available.
~Alterations~
The 15/15/15 and long description of this jar can be changed freely.  A show is not possible.
Please keep in mind that the noun can change, but should be something feasible to have a lid and be made of glass (jar, bottle, etc.)
Special merchants can improve your jar in the following ways:
* Add more potential leech designs that can be PULLed. (Premade)
* Add a completely custom leech design that can be PULLed.
* Increase the amount of leeches able to be PULLed daily to a max of 3.
~Customization~
* Material Color and Type: yellowed glass
Note: materials can only be glass, crystal or glaes.
Description of the color should not make it seem completely opaque, as messaging indicates being able to see the liquid inside.
NOTE: If using glaes, do NOT make it transparent.  It should be colored like stained glass.
* Lid: lid
Note: this should be a 'lid' or 'top' of some sort.
* Wrapping Material: twine
This is the interwoven netting wrapping/encasing the jar.
The yellowed glass jar will cost 2,000,000 coins.

items.name: a sharp veniom corset stay attached to a suede cord

raw: Analysis of a sharp veniom corset stay attached to a suede cord indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This item is a wearable lockpick with the following verbs:
WEAR, REMOVE, PINCH, PUSH, EAT.  It is fully unlocked.
It can be freely altered as long as the noun is appropriate for a lockpick.

There are two things you can customize about the item your lockpick is worn from - the material and the noun.  For instance, if your item was "a smooth vaalin lockpick suspended from a gold necklace," you can customize the "gold" and "necklace" to show up in the messaging.  Otherwise, the default is "silver chain" and any alterations must match.  Any willing merchant can customize these settings for you.  Any workable rare materials must be provided.
The following nouns for are appropriate for the customized aspect of a sharp veniom corset stay attached to a suede cord.
Thong, strap, ribbon, chain, cord.
The veniom corset stay will cost 15,000,000 coins.

items.name: a curled rolton horn banded with golden imflass

raw: Analysis of a curled rolton horn banded with golden imflass indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This item may be altered with a long or a showy description; however, the noun must remain "hunting horn."  No battle horns or any other sorts of horns are allowed.  Only natural materials may be used to make up the horn: animal horn, ivory, or wood.
This item is belt worn and references a being held by a thong.  While the alteration does not have to incorporate that, it cannot contradict it.
You feel that you'd get special messages when you WEAR, RUB, KISS, or RAISE the horn.  Rangers also have access to WHISTLE, SMOOCH, and EXHALE.
The rolton horn will cost 1,000,000 coins.
Analysis of an ivory-inlaid mithril necklace indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The mithril necklace will cost 500,000 coins.
It has 0 charges.  It is rechargeable.
It will persist after its last magical charge has been expended.
It is an enhancive item:
It seems to have several enhancive charges remaining.
It is estimated to be worth about 36,000 silvers.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by a bard.
Analysis of a rune-etched alexandrite crown indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The alexandrite crown will cost 80,000 coins.
Analysis of a turquoise-set gold crown indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The gold crown will cost 150,000 coins.
It has 0 charges.
It will persist after its last magical charge has been expended.
It is an enhancive item:
It seems to have quite a few enhancive charges remaining.
It is estimated to be worth about 37,000 silvers.
It is magic resistant.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by a bard.

Smooth brown leather has been treated to form a rigid pair of miniature saddlebags.  A simple silver clasp is the only adornment.  The interior is divided into twelve tiny compartments, each carefully lined with soft felt.
It is estimated that some miniature saddlebags can store a somewhat small amount with enough space for any number of items of very small size.
The saddlebags can not be worn.
Analysis of some miniature saddlebags indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This saddlebags is designed to hold Siegery pieces.  Closing the saddlebags will repair any damage to Siegery pieces contained within.  The repair process takes twenty seconds, during which time the saddlebags is locked.  At the end of the repair time, the saddlebags will unlock itself.
It is fully alterable, but please note the script provides a description which must make sense for any alteration.

Try as you might, you cannot get a good sense of whether or not the saddlebags's pockets could get any deeper, but you might be able to have a talented merchant lighten the miniature saddlebags for you.
The miniature saddlebags will cost 5,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a twisted purple linen turban indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The turban has four custom feature settings.  It can't have anymore.
When adding custom feature settings, it will be just like altering your hair quirk (or unique line if you're bald).  An example would be:
tucked under a twisted purple linen turban, which is tightly knotted in the back.
He has a twisted purple linen turban covering his bald head.
with a twisted purple linen turban placed at the crown of his head.
He has a twisted purple linen turban placed at the crown of his bald head.

Please note, that if you have the custom settings made for someone bald, it won't look right for someone with hair, and vice versa.  You also can't wear this with another hair quirk/unique field altering item to change your features.  This item isn't limited to just bandana-type items, it can also be a crown, tiara, visored helm, or something similar.
Custom feature 1: concealed beneath a twisted purple linen turban secured with a gem-tipped pin
Custom feature 2: tucked beneath a twisted purple linen turban, which is loosely knotted
Custom feature 3: shrouded by a veil draped from a twisted purple linen turban
Custom feature 4: wrapped by a twisted purple linen turban with loose, billowy ends trailing
The purple linen turban will cost 500,000 coins.

items.name: a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards

raw: Across the surface of the ring, spots of ochre and brown stains radiate from tiny crystalline structures embedded in the bone.  Ichor green motes and shadows lurk within the crystals, living inclusions that alternately lighten and darken the calcification along the ring's edges.  A faint pulse, deep and bone-jarring, accompanies the flickering, beating like a necrotic heart.
Analysis of a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The smooth bone ring is a prize from the Arena of the Abyss (Ebon Gate event).  When worn, it has a chance to summon an undead creature from a recently slain creature.
Attuned: No one
Charges: 0 (ON, PROD to toggle)
Lich's Curse: 0% (ON, TAP to toggle)
Voln's Blessing: 0%
Appearance: ON (COVER to toggle)

Lich's Curse is a % chance for the undead the ring spawns to be a boss creature.  Voln's Blessing is a % chance for the ring owner to receive +15 AS/DS and +10 CS/TD for 30 seconds when they kill the undead the ring spawned.
The ring cannot be altered in any way!
The smooth bone ring will cost 850,000 coins.

raw: Studying the nugget, you notice it is set to the PIN worn location.

Analysis of a faenor nugget indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Your nugget is used to unlock the potential of things held in your other hand or on your person.
A faenor nugget grants the ability to transmute an eligible enhancive armament into a jewelry item.
DETAILS:
> Eligible armaments include armor, weapons, shields, armor accessories, and UCS gloves/boots.
> The armament must be unscripted.  Looted feras items are permitted.
> In most cases, the resulting jewelry item is "a/an/some <material> <noun>."
> Wooden belts will be "a/an <material>-linked belt."
> Enhancive, attunement, and loresong recall properties will transfer.
> The source item will be destroyed.
> Nouns are dictated by the selected worn location for the transmute.
> Use LOOK to view the current setting.
> Use TURN [to #] to toggle to the next or a specific worn location.  Currently: PIN
(1) pin  [pin]           (7)  arms   [armbands]
(2) head [crown]         (8)  wrist  [bracelet]
(3) hair [barrette]      (9)  finger [ring]
(4) ear  [earring]       (10) waist  [belt]
(5) ears [earrings]      (11) ankle  [anklet]
(6) neck [necklace]
You need only RAISE your nugget while holding a compatible item in your other hand or on your person.
Your nugget may not be altered or changed in any way.
The faenor nugget will cost 40,000,000 coins.

items.name: a kaajkur scorched with dragonscale patterning

raw: Crafted in the Finnian style, the kaajkur bears a low-rise pommel and stirrups that hang down at a middling length.
The kaajkur can not be worn.
Analysis of a kaajkur scorched with dragonscale patterning indicates the creator has provided the following information:
--------- VIEW FROM A STAG SADDLES - ANALYZE INFO  ---------
This kaajkur is a View From a Stag saddle meant for use with "cervid" mounts.
Verb Sets active on this kaajkur:
*Verb Set 1:  DROP/PUT, GET, MOUNT (with styles), and DISMOUNT (with styles).
*Verb Set 2:  ATTEND, NUDGE, PULL, RUB, LEAN.
*Verb Set 3:  TILT, RAISE, TOUCH, CLENCH, PUSH
MOUNT styles -- MOUNT {STYLE} {target cervid} -- that are valid for this kaajkur's current setup are:  RIGHT; LEFT; POMMEL; MANE; JUMP; GRACE-L; GRACE-R
DISMOUNT styles -- DISMOUNT {STYLE} -- that are valid for this kaajkur's current setup are:  POMMEL; MANE, JUMP, SLIDE, GRACE-L, GRACE-R

The kaajkur can have various accessories added to it, if they were made specifically for a kaajkur:  a saddle pad, a saddle blanket, and either bells or trim.  If you have an accessory, you will need to hold both items and SLAP the saddle to add it; to remove an accessory, PRY for bells/trim, and PINCH or PINCH KAAJKUR WITH {PAD|BLANKET} for pad/blanket.  Some accessories change the long description.  This kaajkur currently has NO accessories attached.
--------- ALTERATION INFORMATION ---------

The noun cannot change.  So what can you do?  Any merchant may alter the article, adjective, and/or long description of the kaajkur.  They can also add a show description that will append to the hard-coded LOOK.  All alterations must be in keeping with the saddle's style (see below).  It is also recommended that you avoid show descriptions that rely on the long description being present because accessories can temporarily change the long description.
Note that some aspects of the LOOK are hard-coded (such as the length of the stirrups) and cannot currently be modified by a merchant.

This saddle's style (which is not currently eligible to be changed to another style) is set to kaajkur (Finnian).  For alteration purposes, keep the following in mind:  Its pommel is low-rise (doesn't really jut up vertically), and the cantle is what you'd expect from a "normal" saddle.  The stirrups are loose (no flaps).  It utilizes a billet and buckle girth type system for saddling.  It will usually include a pad or not use anything underneath at all.  It is somewhat light compared to other saddle styles.
The kaajkur will cost 8,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a soft tawny leather halter strap indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a summoning item and will currently summon: a sleek golden doe, which is a mountable creature that has the following characteristics:
Height: approximately 38 inches high
Face: slender
Ears: tapered
Forelock (Antlers): a nubby set of antlers
Body: sleek (NOTE: This sets/changes mount article.)
Paw: (Hoof): cloven
Summoning devices can now be altered as long as the noun does not change.
USAGE:   HOLD (refresh HOME timer - must be in same room), PULL, WAVE (summon mount)
Mounts cannot be:
- summoned while inside.
- ridden inside or in water.
- used while in combat.  You will be knocked off your mount if you are attacked and may be unable to mount the creature for a short time after combat has ended.
- summoned or used in some areas of Open Sea Adventures.
Mounts will:
- return to their "home" (either permanent or otherwise) if they are summoned and not mounted within 30 minutes.  (HOLD <strap> to refresh.)
- return to their "home" (either permanent or otherwise) if they are sent home by the owner/summoner.  (DISMISS/SLAP)
- remain in their permanent "home" (if you have purchased a stall).
- not follow you out of the stall.
- follow you wherever you go provided you are in a location where the mount is capable of reaching you.

Preserved under a grey-tinged lacquer, the hazelwood device is accented with blackened steel toggles, gears, buttons, and levers.  Glass rods are visible within a window that takes up the entire left side, the uppermost one completely clear.  A small door on the back has a flashing bright circle of amber over it, while a nearby window flashes with the number "0."  Another window, next to a small knob, has a readout of the word "paint" within its oblong frame.  Attached to the bottom of the device is a simple iron plaque affixed to its side that is bound in place with blackened steel screws and has crisp lettering engraved into its smooth face proclaiming, "~*~ The Paint-in-ator 3000 ~*~."

Attached to the bottom of the device is a simple  plaque affixed to its side that is bound in place with  screws and has crisp lettering engraved into its smooth face proclaiming "~*~ The Paint-in-ator 3000 ~*~".
Analysis of a greyish hazelwood device indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Welcome to the one, the only, and the never-before-seen "Paint-in-ator 3000"!

This incredible, amazing, and often underestimated item will thrill you with its ability to store paint.  That's right, Brodega!  It stores paint!  If you aren't sure what to do with paint, then you clearly do not understand the physical strain of a crafter!
Instructions:
1. Hold your paint in hand
2. POUR your paint IN the Paint-in-ator 3000
3. Marvel at the relief to your shoulders as you shed weight
4. GAZE at your Paint-in-ator 3000 to see all the stored paints
Retrieval Instructions:
1. PUSH a crystal amulet (or any of its cousins) into the Paint-in-ator.  (she's a hungry beast!)
2. TAP the Paint-in-ator to determine how many doses you want to retrieve (options: 1 - 5)
3. SPIN the Paint-in-ator to cycle through all the stored paint (50 is max)
4. NUDGE the Paint-in-ator to cycle between paintstick and vial options
5. TURN the Paint-in-ator to collect your paint or paintstick
Please note, any paints poured into the "Paint-in-ator 3000" are consumed by it and can only be retrieved using the methods listed above.
That's right, Brodega, it is that simple!

The Paint-in-ator has the following commands: gaze (displays all stored paint), nudge (cycles between paint and paintstick options), poke (turns on/off third person messaging for spin & tap), pour (adds paint to the device), prod (turns on/off long analyze), pull (removes crystal amulet from the device), push (adds crystal amulet to device), spin (cycles through available paint), tap (cycles through doses to create), turn (provides paint), and whisper (jumps to paint #)
The "Paint-in-ator 3000" is Tier 2 of 2.

Altering Instructions:  The Paint-in-ator must always be a box of some kind and must always be belt-worn.  Due to its complicated (patent pending) dials, chambers, switches, and toggles, it can never support a SHOW DESCRIPTION, but it can handle long descriptions.

Disclaimers:  The Paint-in-ator is a sensitive device and as such its creators wish to remind you that it is made for good fun.  As a result, it has restrictions on it to prevent the harm of small children and animals.  The creators do not want any accusations of "The Paint-in-ator ate my baby!"  Please be sure to always use the Paint-in-ator appropriately.  Drinking while using the Paint-in-ator forfeits all warranties, guarantees, and most lacquers.  Do not place your hands in the device while it is in use, as the creators will not be held responsible for missing digits.  And, for the love of all that is holy, do not bring a knife anywhere near it.  Do not use in the bath, as the creators will not be held responsible for what may happen.  For your safety, do not break these rules.
Customization fields:
Toggles: blackened steel
Lacquer: grey-tinged
Device Material: hazelwood
Metal Plate: iron
The hazelwood device will cost 450,000 coins.

Analysis of a rune-carved shadowy black belt indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The shadowy black belt may be freely altered, but it must make sense that it can have pockets/compartments of some kind, and must include the description of runes along its surface, in either the short or long or show description to match the item's messaging.

The shadowy black belt is an Essence Belt, which can be charged by DROPping specific alchemy ingredient essences into it to grant its bearer unique abilities.  The belt will accept the following essences: air, earth, fire, water, regeneration, vitality, body, mind, soul.
slot 1: fire (805/1000)
slot 2: none
slot 3: earth (920/1000)
slot 4: water (600/1000)

Once fueled, the active element can be set by WHISPERing to the belt with the name of the essence, which is currently set to earth.  The active element will determine the behavior of the belt's abilities.

The belt is currently tier 4 of 4, which means that it can accommodate up to 4 essence slots, the last of which can be occupied by a superior essence (regeneration, vitality, body, mind, soul).  An essence slot can be cleared via POKE, though this will remove all charges of that essence once confirmed.  The belt currently has access to the following abilities: reactive flares, PUSH (resistance), PULL (attack strength bonus), RUB (special).  It will also respond to the following verbs: TAP, TOUCH, TURN.
The shadowy black belt will cost 100,000,000 coins.

Analysis of an applewood heart-shaped locket indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is the "Variable Expression" version of a portrait locket.  The following may be altered by a willing merchant:  the base (15/15/15); a long description; the picture that is visible inside of the locket when it is open; the outside surface (this will always be preceded by the words, "The outside of the locket is"); and the read.  None of these aspects may contradict one another.

To create a portrait of yourself in the locket, simply OPEN it while it is in your right hand.  Once the portrait is made, you cannot alter the picture without the help of a willing merchant.  Bear in mind that when the initial portrait is made of someone using this locket, it will show him or her as a giggly person.  Some merchants may be willing to change the initial portrait "personality" (prior to the portrait being taken) for you (options are: curmudgeon, giggly, evil, haughty, joyful/adventurous, flirt, moody, confident, triumphant, happy drunk, peaceful, bookworm, romantic, gambler, vain, daredevil).
Currently you are able to COVER, OPEN, TUCK, and CLOSE the locket.  This locket may be unlocked further by a very small handful of merchants.
A small handful of merchants may be able and willing to attune this locket to a beloved.
The heart-shaped locket will cost 150,000 coins.

items.name: a strip of thin brass wire

raw: A strip of thin parchment covers the reverse side of a strip of thin brass wire.  You spot what might be a few drops of glue glistening from underneath.
The wire can not be worn.
Analysis of a strip of thin brass wire indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This thin brass wire can be added to a weapon as trim.  It may be altered, but should be something that can be wrapped, wound, or braided around the hilt, haft, grip, or fuller of a weapon, and is a one-use item.
To use this item,
PUT wire ON {weapon} for a "wound" look,
SLAP {weapon} WITH wire for a "wrapped" look, or
TWIST wire AT {weapon} for a "braided" look.
PROD the wire in order to adjust the three attachment methods.
The thin brass wire will cost 50,000 coins.

Analysis of a gnarled shadowglass wand indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Wand Combiner ~*~

Welcome to the wand combiner!  This item allows you to combine like-to-like wand charges into a single item.  This item is Tier 1 out of 2, and it allows up to 50 charges.  You can CLENCH to empty it of the current spell and charges.

Alterations:  Any willing merchant can alter this item freely, but it must remain something wand-like.  Wands/rods/batons are all examples of acceptable nouns for a wand-like item.  Because the spell can change when there are no charges and a new wand is pushed in, it cannot indicate any specific spell.  There is an append to LOOKing at it; this changes depending on what spell is in there and how many charges remain, and these cannot be altered.
Charges:  No charges or spells stored in the wand at this time.
The shadowglass wand will cost 60,000 coins.

items.name: a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards

raw: Across the surface of the ring, spots of ochre and brown stains radiate from tiny crystalline structures embedded in the bone.  Ichor green motes and shadows lurk within the crystals, living inclusions that alternately lighten and darken the calcification along the ring's edges.  A faint pulse, deep and bone-jarring, accompanies the flickering, beating like a necrotic heart.
Analysis of a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The smooth bone ring is a prize from the Arena of the Abyss (Ebon Gate event).  When worn, it has a chance to summon an undead creature from a recently slain creature.
Attuned: No one
Charges: 0 (ON, PROD to toggle)
Lich's Curse: 0% (ON, TAP to toggle)
Voln's Blessing: 0%
Appearance: ON (COVER to toggle)

Lich's Curse is a % chance for the undead the ring spawns to be a boss creature.  Voln's Blessing is a % chance for the ring owner to receive +15 AS/DS and +10 CS/TD for 30 seconds when they kill the undead the ring spawned.
The ring cannot be altered in any way!
The smooth bone ring will cost 1,000,000 coins.
It is estimated that a lacquered square basket can store a fairly small amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of a lacquered square basket indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Welcome to the Basketifier, straight out of the shop Preserving Breads at Evermore Hollow!
This basket is designed to hold food items for you.  It will keep them fresh and unlimited until you decide to remove them.
It is currently tier 1 of 4, which means it will house 4 food items.
It can store more food items and unlock more functionality at higher tiers, which can be obtained by purchasing certificates in its shop of origin.
To use the basket, simply follow these steps:
1. PUT - use this to add food items to the basket.
2. RUB - use this to prepare a food item for removal.
3. TURN - Use this to remove a food item from the basket.  (must be charged with a small statue)
A lacquered square basket has 1 charges stored in it that can be used to remove food.
Alterations:
The basket may be altered freely, but it must remain a basket.  It can have a long or show description.
Customizing food in the basket is a special, delayed service.
The square basket will cost 225,000 coins.

items.name: a sacrosanct night black battle standard with a rippling silver sheen

raw: A faint silver sheen ripples along the standard's fabric at measured intervals, a counterpoint to the pulsing gleam of the runes scribed along the full length of the pole.
You determine that you could wear a sacrosanct night black battle standard with a rippling silver sheen as a battle standard.
Analysis of a sacrosanct night black battle standard with a rippling silver sheen indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a tier 1 Battle Standard.
Tier
1: Rally [PRAY] - While dead, allows a corpse to teleport itself back to town.  1 use per day at tier 1 and 2 uses per day at tier 3.

2: Hallowed Reprisal [CLENCH] - Invoke the power of the standard's deity to create an aura that periodically lashes out at nearby creatures for 3 minutes.  Base 60 minute cooldown with 15 minutes subtracted at tiers 3, 4, and 5, resulting in a 15 minute cooldown at tier 5.
3: Reckoning - Your attacks have a chance to unleash the power of the standard's deity.  Tiers 4 and 5 increase the likelihood that this will occur.

4: Ardent Plea [RAISE] - Your attacks have a 100% chance to trigger Reckoning and unleash the power of the standard's deity.  This effect lasts 30 seconds and has a 30 minute cooldown.  At tier 5 the cooldown is reduced to 15 minutes.

5: Divine Bulwark - When you receive a blow, the standard may summon an ethereal shield to lessen the severity of the blow.  If an ethereal shield is summoned in this way, the standard's deity will unleash a retaliatory flare against the attacker.

6: Final Stand [BESEECH] - The standard's deity comes to your aid for 30 seconds, ensuring that all incoming blows will be subject to Divine Bulwark's abilities.  Can be activated while incapacitated or in roundtime.  1 use per day.
Attunement:                       Not Attuned
Charges:                          200
Deity:                            Ronan
Deity Primary Color:              Night black
Deity Secondary Color:            Silver
Rally [PRAY]:                     Ready

If the standard's deity conversion ability is not on cooldown, you may visit a shrine honoring a specific deity to convert the standard to that deity.  To do so, simply PRAY standard TO <deity>.  This ability is subject to a 30 day cooldown, and the cooldown is not currently active.
The battle standard can be TUCKed while worn in order to hide it from sight.

This is a flag on a pole, and the description should not conflict with that.  Base, long, and show description can be altered.  Because of the holy and magical nature of this item, the description may include the following words: holy, sacred, consecrated, sacrosanct, and hallowed.

There will always be a reference to the pole and the banner upon LOOKing at this item.  Please take this into account when composing your show description.  The material may be changed to other types of wood at the merchant's discretion.  Allowed nouns: standard, flag, banner, ensign, pennant, pennon, banderole, banderol, bannerol, oriflamme, and gonfalon.  Finally, any and all alterations will be irreversibly removed if the battle standard is ever converted to another deity in the future.
The battle standard may not be lightened.
The battle standard will cost 3,000,000 coins.

items.name: a brass and gold capsule with a glass dome

raw: The brass and gold capsule is divided into two halves, with the top portion being crafted from glass and the bottom portion wrought from brass and gold.  Through the transparent glass, ten chambers are exposed inside the capsule, each detailed with a miniature replica of the cities and towns across Elanthia.  A glowing ring surrounds the chamber for Ta'Illistim currently.  It appears that the capsule can hold 50 Chronomage spheres in each chamber.  An enruned opening is situated between both halves of the capsule.  The brass and gold capsule contains no brass and gold spheres in the Ta'Illistim chamber.
The capsule can not be worn.
Analysis of a brass and gold capsule with a glass dome indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a container to hold your Chronomage spheres.  The spheres must NOT be attuned to you, used in a waiting room, or have an expirations.  This capsule holds 50 spheres in each chamber.  This can be expanded to hold more by special vouchers or rare merchants that will dabble in such arts.
Usage:
LOOK at MY capsule            - Look at the chambers inside.
PUT {sphere} [in] MY capsule  - Insert a sphere inside the proper chamber.
PUSH MY capsule               - Eject a sphere from inside the capsule.
TURN MY capsule               - Change which chamber it is set to.
RUB MY capsule                - Reveal the contents of each chamber instantly.
The brass and gold capsule will cost 5,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a bundle of blue macaw fletchings indicates the creator has provided the following information:

You get the distinct impression that any willing merchant can alter the fletchings, but be aware that only the "adjective" part of the fletchings's base will show up on a finished arrow (meaning, only the adjective part of the 15/15/15 (the middle 15) will show up on fletched arrows).  Due to this, some merchants may only be willing to alter that part of your fletchings.

Alterations to the adjective must make sense to be on a fletching.  This includes: colors; paint and dyes (eg. blue-painted, red-dyed, green-stained); designs that make sense on a small fletching (pink-striped, trident-stamped); or feathers of a specific bird (green parrot, mottled falcon).  Nothing crazy, like attachable adornments (no deathstone-studded fletchings!), are allowed.
The blue macaw fletchings will cost 50,000 coins.

You see a jointed wooden doll that has been glued together.  The doll has lightly oiled ebon black hair bound in a single three-stranded braid and has long-lashed violet eyes that stare blankly at you.  It has an aristocratic nose centered on its tiny face, and two slender ears are secured to its head.  It is wearing a diamond-studded gauzy ebon veil, a black rapture cloak, a flame-sleeved scarlet spidersilk cotehardie, and a pair of black silk stockings.  It is holding nothing in its right hand and nothing in its left hand.
There is no core inside the chest cavity.
The doll can not be worn.
Analysis of a jointed wooden doll indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a jointed wooden doll.  It has been glued together, evidenced by the lightly blue-tinged substance filling the joint spaces.

Usage: (glued doll) DANCE, GROWL, KISS, LOOK, POKE, TURN.  You can also accessorize your doll with pieces found within Delirium Manor.  Hold an accessory in your left hand and a glued doll in your right, and PUSH <accessory>.  Accessory pieces cannot be removed, but they can be overwritten.
Usage: (unglued doll with 6 body parts) DANCE, GROWL, KISS, LOOK, POKE, PULL, and TURN.
Usage: (unfinished doll) DROP (piece ON torso), LOOK, PULL, and TURN
The wooden doll will cost 2,500,000 coins.

items.name: a pair of vaalin-sigiled silk gloves

raw: The fine fabric of these gloves has an unusual sheen coating the surface.  Imbedded somehow within the weave of the fabric on the back of each hand is a large vaalin sigil.  The sigil has a slight opalescent cast reminiscent of vaalin, but the actual material remains a mystery.
It is estimated that a pair of vaalin-sigiled silk gloves can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
Analysis of a pair of vaalin-sigiled silk gloves indicates the creator has provided the following information:

These gloves are made to be worn by pure magical professions.  They can be altered, but require the sigils to remain intact and the gloves should be made of fabric.  They also have a set show description that can't be removed, but more can be added to it.  The sigils are currently described as vaalin.  The sigils can be changed, but are limited to a 15 character descriptor.
You can tell that the gloves are as light as they can get, but you might be able to have a talented merchant deepen their pockets for you.
The vaalin-sigiled gloves will cost 500,000 coins.

This appears to be a collectible case of some kind, with small trays secured to a slender axle to allow for rotation.  A trio of gears is secured to the interior base of the case.  Looking through your doll case, you realize all the trays are empty.
It is estimated that a decorative doll case can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
Analysis of a decorative doll case indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This case will store collectible doll pieces and accessories from Delirium Manor.  Charged cores and glued dolls will not fit inside the case.  Alterations are fine as long as it remains a belt-worn box-type container.  No sacks, satchels, bags, etc.
Use TURN to rotate through the trays, and use PULL to remove an item from the selected tray.

This case is Tier 2, and it can hold up to 30 different doll parts and accessories without taking up precious storage space!  However, please note that if you REGISTER your item, accessories and parts stored inside will NOT be saved/recorded.  You must REGISTER those items separately, before placing them inside your container.  Despite any messages below, this item cannot be lightened or deepened.
The doll case will cost 3,000,000 coins.

Inset into the simple, polished platinum ring is a faceted crystalline gem.  The gem glows with a fiery red light.
Analysis of a crystal-inset platinum ring indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a Ghule ring (modern-style).

You get the sense that this ring can be altered, though there are some restrictions.  Any merchant can change its base and long description, but it must remain a ring of some kind.  The only elements of its show description that can be altered are the material of the ring and the COLOR of 'glow' that the gem on it is giving off.

If altering the glow color: it must be a COLOR.  Stick to the actual hue/shade (not other things that it could be doing, like glowing, scintillating, or pulsing, for example), and specifically avoid "deep" in the color and "-hued" to prevent double wording in some messaging (-colored, etc. is fine).  Avoid going overboard on modifiers.
Your ring is currently set to the following color:  fiery red.
Currently you are able to STARE/PEER/GAZE at the ring.  This ring may be unlocked further (to allow for more color options) within special, rare circumstances.
The platinum ring will cost 1,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a petrified bat wing indicates the creator has provided the following information:
When REDEEMed, this wing will grant a custom manna to your character:
Bread Description: a honeyed bat wing
Flavor 1: Glazed with rich honey and seasoned with garlic, lemon, and black pepper, the piquant flavors meld together in a bold blend of mouthwatering spices and a chicken-like taste.
Flavor 2: Pungent spurts of pepper shoot through smooth bands of honey and garlic only to be chased away by a sharp eruption of lemony goodness.  A meaty aftertaste lingers on your tongue.
The bat wing will cost 2,000,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

When REDEEMed, this eel will grant a custom manna to your character:
Bread Description: a mist grey jellied eel
Flavor 1: The jelly gives way at the slightest taste, dissolving into a sea-salty, slightly rancid goo.  The chunks of eel are chewy and undercooked.

Flavor 2: Chewy bits of undercooked eel slither across your tongue as the gelatin dissipates in a rush of slimy, salty goo.  Just when you thought the experience was completed, undercurrents of rancid kelp and unidentified spices explode upon the palate.
The grey jellied eel will cost 2,000,000 coins.

items.name: a lacquered hip-satchel woven from green reeds

raw: Cinched with cords and secured by a driftwood clasp, the hip-satchel features numerous compartments arranged within its hazel flax-lined interior.
It is estimated that a lacquered hip-satchel woven from green reeds can store a slightly large amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of a lacquered hip-satchel woven from green reeds indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The lacquered hip-satchel is a Survivalist's Kit, which is a specialized container for storing healing herbs.  All herbs stack up to 50 by default and maintain the weight of a single dose.  Doses may be removed one at a time from within the hip-satchel.  Herbs may be discarded from the hip-satchel entirely by PULLing on them.  The hip-satchel otherwise functions as a normal container that may be altered, lightened, and deepened per standard guidelines.
This hip-satchel has the Liquid Storage unlock, which allows it to store liquid herbs in addition to their solid counterparts.  Liquid herb storage is affected by any Capacity unlocks.
The hip-satchel will also respond to the following verbs: PEER (when not empty), CLEAN, GAZE, PINCH, RUB, TOUCH
Current herb stock:
None.
Unlocks:
Capacity: 1/5 (50 charges maximum per herb)
Liquid Storage unlock: yes
Extractor unlock (requires Liquid Storage): no
Potency unlock (requires Liquid Storage): no
The lacquered hip-satchel is set up with natural-themed messaging, which cannot typically be altered.
The following descriptions may be customized by a merchant:
- Inner lining description, in "adjective noun" form: hazel flax
This should be some form of fabric/leather.
- Container close mechanism, in "adjective noun" form: driftwood clasp
This must end in one of the following: buckle, drawstrings, clasp, latch, toggle.
- Extractor indicator description, in "article adjective" form: a wave-carved
- Extractor toggle description, in "article adjective" form: a driftwood
The lacquered hip-satchel will cost 6,000,000 coins.

items.name: a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards

raw: Across the surface of the ring, spots of ochre and brown stains radiate from tiny crystalline structures embedded in the bone.  Ichor green motes and shadows lurk within the crystals, living inclusions that alternately lighten and darken the calcification along the ring's edges.  A faint pulse, deep and bone-jarring, accompanies the flickering, beating like a necrotic heart.
Analysis of a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The smooth bone ring is a prize from the Arena of the Abyss (Ebon Gate event).  When worn, it has a chance to summon an undead creature from a recently slain creature.
Attuned: No one
Charges: 0 (ON, PROD to toggle)
Lich's Curse: 0% (ON, TAP to toggle)
Voln's Blessing: 0%
Appearance: ON (COVER to toggle)

Lich's Curse is a % chance for the undead the ring spawns to be a boss creature.  Voln's Blessing is a % chance for the ring owner to receive +15 AS/DS and +10 CS/TD for 30 seconds when they kill the undead the ring spawned.
The ring cannot be altered in any way!
The smooth bone ring will cost 1,000,000 coins.
You see the outside of a barbed-edged dark steel locket.
There is nothing to read on the outside of the dark steel locket.
There is nothing to read on the inside of the dark steel locket.
A barbed-edged dark steel locket cannot store anything inside of it at all.
Analysis of a barbed-edged dark steel locket indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is the "Variable Expression" version of a portrait locket.  The following may be altered by a willing merchant:  the base (15/15/15); a long description; the picture that is visible inside of the locket when it is open; the outside surface (this will always be preceded by the words, "The outside of the locket is"); and the read.  None of these aspects may contradict one another.

To create a portrait of yourself in the locket, simply OPEN it while it is in your right hand.  Once the portrait is made, you cannot alter the picture without the help of a willing merchant.  Bear in mind that when the initial portrait is made of someone using this locket, it will show him or her as a haughty person.  Some merchants may be willing to change the initial portrait "personality" (prior to the portrait being taken) for you (options are: curmudgeon, giggly, evil, haughty, joyful/adventurous, flirt, moody, confident, triumphant, happy drunk, peaceful, bookworm, romantic, gambler, vain, daredevil).
Currently you are able to COVER, OPEN, TUCK, and CLOSE the locket.  This locket may be unlocked further by a very small handful of merchants.
A small handful of merchants may be able and willing to attune this locket to a beloved.
The dark steel locket will cost 500,000 coins.
The horsehair can not be worn.
Analysis of a strand of silver horsehair indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A talented merchant can alter this weavable horsehair.  Merchants will require that the horsehair can logically be woven together with a duplicate of itself or other weavable items and make sense for eventually forming an item like a garland or anklet.  Appropriate items are flowers, ribbons, leaves, string, and the like.  Nothing big/bulky.  No "gemstone-mimic" weavables (if it can be confused with an actual gemstone, then it's a no go).  No long and show descriptions are allowed at this time.

When weaving, only the adjective and noun, and sometimes part of the article, will matter, so bear this in mind.  Right now, this horsehair, when woven, will show up as a "strand of silver horsehair," and if there is more than one, you will end up with some "strands of silver horsehair."
To get the full benefit of this horsehair, you can try to WEAVE it WITH another similarly weavable item.  You can also BUNDLE (and BUNDLE REMOVE) identical items.

The lid of this oak case has been exquisitely painted, depicting dramatic colorful scenery from one corner to the other.  Two of the four sides are adorned with large, rounded enamel moons, one faintly luminescent, while the other is tinted in hazy dark hues.  A half-moon, painted in muted yellow tones, is depicted on a third side.  In elegant script, the words "Lornon" and "Liabo" have been inked beneath each of the orbs, while no lettering exists beneath the half-moon.  The Liabo moon is completely flush with the side of the case.
It is estimated that a smooth oak case can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.

Analysis of a smooth oak case indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This oak case (also known as an Arkati Box) can have either a short or a long description, but cannot support a show, as one already exists.  It must also remain some kind of container that would have a lid/top.  The case is currently at Tier 2 and has the following verbs available: PUSH, POKE, TOUCH, TURN, RUB, CLEAN, GAZE, OPEN, CLOSE, LOOK and PUT.  Though the case may not be unlocked further, if you win a raffle version, you could opt to have your current case adjusted to the raffle tier.  Your case is aligned to: Liabo.  This was first released at Ebon Gate 2014 in Go Figure, owned by Bisha.
Try as you might, you cannot get a good sense of whether or not the case's pockets could get any deeper, but you can tell that the case is as light as it can get.
The oak case will cost 25,000 coins.
